qas.question: What asserts that energy is always conserved and that heat flow is a form of energy transfer.
The first law of thermodynamics asserts that what is always conserved and that heat flow is a form of energy transfer?
What is a commonly used corollary of the first law?

answers.text: for a system subject only to pressure forces and heat transfer (e.g., a cylinder-full of gas) without chemical changes

qas.question: What asserts that energy is always conserved and that cool flow is a form of energy transfer.
The first law of thermodynamics asserts that what is never conserved and that heat flow is a form of energy transfer?

plausible_answers.text: for a system subject only to pressure forces and heat transfer (e.g., a cylinder-full of gas) without chemical changes

qas.question: What is a never used corollary of the first law?

plausible_answers.text: system subject only to pressure forces and heat transfer

qas.question: what is an example of a pyramid-full of gas
What type of system has a poorly defined temperature and pressure
